source.a15a7e9d: Seeing the number of reviews and rating people loved reading Delia Owens fiction with rating of 4.8 which happens to be greater than the average rating and review count of more than 80000.
source.3ae8d32b:
Seeing at the above pairplot we can say that there is no or very less correlation that exist in the data between different variables.
People mostly pay between 0 to 50 rupees for books that have a User Rating greater than 4.5. and no of reviews exist between 20000.
source.6ef6affc:
In the above data since the median is greater than the mean value we can say that the price distribution is right skewed with few outliers present at the higher end of the graph with respect to price, also the reviews distribution is right skewed with fewer outliers present in the higher end of the graph.

The data is left skewed with respect to the User Rating since median is less than the mean value i.e 4.7 > 4.6 with outliers that can be ignored when taking the data to create a model
